alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 3:35PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS...LOWER TREASURE VALLEY...OREGON LOWER TREASURE VALLEY... MALHEUR COUNTY...AND BAKER COUNTY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half mile. This band of heavy snow is so intense that it is producing lightning and thunder. The snow will accumulate very rapidly. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 335 PM MDT/235 PM PDT/, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from Durkee to near Vines Hill and moving northeast at 20 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Durkee, Weatherby, Rye Valley and Dixie around 240 PM PDT. Henley Basin around 350 PM MDT. Big Lookout Mountain and Little Lookout Mountain around 300 PM PDT. Sheep Mountain and Sweedes Landing around 310 PM PDT. McChord Butte around 410 PM MDT. Brosman Mountain around 420 PM MDT. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; West Central Mountains
